verses.text: I will extol thee, O \sc Lord\sc*; for thou hast lifted me up, And hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
O \sc Lord\sc* my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
O \sc Lord\sc*, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: Thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down \add to\add* the pit.
Sing unto the \sc Lord\sc*, O ye saints of his, And give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
For his anger \add endureth but\add* a moment; in his favour \add is\add* life: Weeping may endure for a night, but joy \add cometh\add* in the morning.
And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
\sc Lord\sc*, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: Thou didst hide thy face, \add and\add* I was troubled.
I cried to thee, O \sc Lord\sc*; And unto the \sc Lord\sc* I made supplication.
What profit \add is there\add* in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
Hear, O \sc Lord\sc*, and have mercy upon me: \sc Lord\sc*, be thou my helper.
Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: Thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me \add with\add* gladness;
To the end that \add my\add* glory may sing \add praise\add* to thee, and not be silent. O \sc Lord\sc* my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
